nodes.bodyText: Good point, will remove this logging, and let it return directly
Cache selectList.get(i).getFunctionCall(), same for other places
Can you simplify the logic here and add some comments? Can aliasName be null when AS keyword is found?
technically it shouldn't be null, this is just for sanity check.

What is the SQL standard for AS keyword? Can it work on FUNCTION and LITERAL? If not, we should add sanity check here to block the query. The query should always to valid when it goes to the query engine.
It's up to us to set it, here we compile it into a function call with operator = 'AS', operands[0] as alias_from_expression and operands[0] as alias_to_expression
Please add some comments explaining why this can happen
We should not perform sanity check here, but when we compile the query. At this point, alias should always exist and should always be identifier.
make sense, will update the query parsing logic there.
